item.title: 古巴在危机日益加剧之际宣布 "战时经济 "新措施
item.description: 古巴政府周日晚些时候表示，将加倍加强价格控制，并继续打击逃税行为，以求遏制财政赤字膨胀和通胀飙升对古巴经济造成的破坏。【原文：Cuba`s government said late on Sunday it would double down on price controls and continue to fight tax evasion in an increasingly desperate bid to tamp down on a ballooning fiscal deficit and spiraling inflation that have devastated its economy.】

item.title: 百时美施贵宝支付 270 万美元解决以色列反竞争指控
item.description: 以色列竞争管理局周一表示，百时美施贵宝公司已同意在以色列支付 1,000 万谢克尔（270 万美元），以解决其阻止仿制抗癌药 Imnovid 的潜在案件。【原文：Bristol Myers Squibb has agreed to pay 10 million shekels ($2.7 million) in Israel to settle a potential case over its blocking of a generic version for anti-cancer drug Imnovid, Israel's Competition Authority said on Monday.】

item.title: 激进投资者发起的竞选活动数量创历史新高，但赢得的董事会席位却越来越少
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays）的数据显示，在 2024 年的前六个月里，激进投资者在全球范围内发起活动的公司数量创下了历史新高，但由于公司进行了有效的反击，激进投资者打入董事会的成功率并不高。【原文：Activist investors mounted campaigns at a record number of companies globally during the first six months of 2024 but have been less successful in breaking into boardrooms as companies fought back effectively, data from Barclays shows.】

item.title: 对冲基金流向 高盛数据显示对冲基金错过法国大选后股票跳涨行情
item.description: 根据高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）6月28日的一份报告，对冲基金押注银行股上涨，上周以2021年5月以来最快的速度放弃了交易，这意味着他们错过了周一法国大选第一轮投票后银行股的涨势。【原文：Hedge funds betting on a rise in banking shares abandoned trades last week at the fastest pace since May 2021, according to a June 28 Goldman Sachs note, meaning they missed the sector's rally on Monday after the first round in the French election.】

item.title: 焦点转向就业数据，期指寸步难行
item.description: 周一，美国股指期货在制造业采购经理人指数数据公布前走高，本周晚些时候的美国劳动力市场数据也将成为关注焦点，这些数据将为美联储的货币政策路径提供线索。【原文：U.S. stock index futures edged higher on Monday ahead of manufacturing PMI data, with focus also on U.S. labor market numbers later in the week that will be parsed for cues on the Federal Reserve's monetary policy path.】

item.title: 以人工智能为重点的科技公司 6 月市值大幅跃升
item.description: 以人工智能为重点的公司（主要是芯片制造商）的市值在 6 月底出现大幅增长，其中英伟达（Nvidia）曾短暂超越微软，成为全球最有价值的公司。【原文：Artificial intelligence-focused companies, mostly chipmakers, saw big gains in their market capitalization at the end of June, with Nvidia briefly overtaking Microsoft to become the most valuable company in the world.】

item.title: 股票影响者 "Roaring Kitty "披露持有 Chewy 6.6% 的股份
item.description: 被称为 "Roaring Kitty "的股票影响者基思-吉尔（Keith Gill）周一披露持有 Chewy 6.6% 的股份，使这家宠物产品零售商的股价在盘前交易中上涨了 16%。【原文：Keith Gill, the stock influencer known as "Roaring Kitty", on Monday disclosed a 6.6% stake in Chewy , sending shares of the pet products retailer 16% higher in premarket trading.】

item.title: 美国最高法院将对涉及借记卡 "刷卡费 "的案件作出裁决
item.description: 美国最高法院预计将于周一对一起涉及对美联储关于借记卡 "刷卡费 "规定的法律挑战的案件作出裁决，这一裁决可能会使企业更容易试图推翻长期存在的联邦规定。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court was expected on Monday to decide a case involving a legal challenge to a Federal Reserve regulation on debit card "swipe fees" in a ruling that could make it easier for businesses to try to overturn longstanding federal rules.】

item.title: 早间竞标下半年开始，市场押注法国僵局
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: Tiny Chain Bridge 是特朗普和共和党竞选活动的顶级银行家
item.description: 当共和党竞选团队需要一位银行家时，他们不会去纽约或旧金山，而是去弗吉尼亚州的麦克莱恩市中心--距离白宫大约 20 分钟车程，在那里，一家汽车修理店旁边只有一家分行的银行击败了更大的金融竞争对手，成为政治工作中必备的合作伙伴。【原文：When Republican campaigns want a banker, they don't go to New York or San Francisco, but to downtown McLean, Virginia - about a 20 minute drive from the White House, where a one-branch bank next to an auto repair shop has beaten bigger financial rivals to become a must-have partner for political work.】

item.title: 瑞银完成与瑞士信贷的瑞士业务合并
item.description: 瑞士联合银行（UBS）周一表示，该行已完成其国内业务部门与瑞士信贷（Credit Suisse）在其国内市场业务的合并，并补充说瑞士信贷的业务主管即将离开该行。【原文：Swiss bank UBS has completed the merger of its domestic unit with Credit Suisse's operations in its home market, the bank said on Monday, adding that the head of the Credit Suisse business was leaving the bank.】

item.title: 聚焦：亚马逊回避贝索斯参与资助的碳补偿标准
item.description: 亚马逊是第一家避开全球碳抵消核查标准的公司，该标准由一家非营利组织制定，主要由这家美国科技企业集团的创始人兼执行主席杰夫-贝索斯（Jeff Bezos）资助。【原文：Amazon has become the first company to sidestep a global standard for verifying carbon offsets that was developed by a non-profit funded largely by the U.S. technology conglomerate's founder and executive chair, Jeff Bezos.】

item.title: 特斯拉交付量将连续第二个季度下降
item.description: 特斯拉 6 月份的交付量可能会下降 3.7%，这是这家顶级电动汽车制造商首次出现连续两个季度的下滑，因为它要应对中国市场的激烈竞争，以及由于缺乏经济实惠的新车型而导致的需求放缓。【原文：Tesla's June-quarter deliveries likely fell 3.7%, the first time the top EV maker is set to post two straight quarters of decline, as it deals with stiff competition in China and slow demand due to a lack of affordable new models.】

item.title: Meta 被控未遵守欧盟技术规则
item.description: Meta Platforms 周一受到欧盟反垄断监管机构的指控，称其未能遵守具有里程碑意义的技术规则，监管机构矛头直指其新推出的付费或同意广告模式。【原文：Meta Platforms was charged by EU antitrust regulators on Monday for failing to comply with landmark tech rules as they took aim at its newly introduced pay or consent advertising model.】

item.title: 英美资源集团股价在澳大利亚矿山停产后下跌
item.description: 英美资源集团（Anglo American）周末在澳大利亚格罗夫纳（Grosvenor）炼钢煤矿发生地下火灾，导致该煤矿暂停生产，周一该公司股价下跌3%。【原文：Shares in Anglo American slid 3% on Monday after the miner suspended production at its Grosvenor steelmaking coal mine in Australia following an underground fire that broke out over the weekend.】

item.title: 跨山输油管道首月装载量与目标相差无几
item.description: 周日的船舶跟踪数据显示，在新扩建的跨山管道运营的第一个完整月里，约有 20 艘船舶在加拿大西海岸装载原油，略低于运营商的预测。【原文：About 20 ships loaded crude oil on Canada's West Coast in the first full month of operation on the newly expanded Trans Mountain pipeline, according to vessel-tracking data on Sunday, slightly below the operator's forecast.】

item.title: 法国投票和中国贸易争端为欧洲企业盈利蒙上阴影
item.description: 投资者表示，法国政局的不确定性以及欧盟与中国的贸易争端给欧洲企业的盈利蒙上了一层阴影，尽管有预测称企业将取得更好的业绩。【原文：French political uncertainty and an EU trade spat with China are casting a shadow over European corporate earnings, investors say, despite forecasts that companies are set to deliver better results.】

item.title: 杰富瑞称英美煤炭大火可能影响煤炭销售
item.description: 经纪商杰富瑞（Jefferies）周一在一份报告中称，英美资源集团在澳大利亚的格罗夫纳冶金煤矿发生的火灾可能会对其澳大利亚冶金煤业务产生负面影响。【原文：A fire at Anglo American's Grosvenor metallurgical coal mine in Australia is likely to negatively affect its Australian met coal business, broker Jefferies said in a note on Monday.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：欧盟就 "付费或同意 "指控 Meta
item.description: 据《金融时报》周一报道，欧盟将指控 Facebook 母公司 Meta 违反了该集团具有里程碑意义的数字规则。【原文：The European Union is set to charge Facebook parent Meta with breaking the bloc's landmark digital rules, the Financial Times reported on Monday.】

item.title: 德国商报》称赛诺菲计划在德国投资 16 亿美元
item.description: 据德国《商报》周一报道，法国制药商赛诺菲即将决定在德国法兰克福的一个主要生产基地投资 13 亿至 15 亿欧元（14 亿至 16 亿美元），用于生产胰岛素品牌 Lantus。【原文：French drugmaker Sanofi is nearing a decision to invest between 1.3 billion euros and 1.5 billion euros ($1.4-$1.6 billion) at a major production site in Frankfurt, Germany, where it makes insulin brand Lantus, newspaper Handelsblatt reported on Monday.】

item.title: 西捷航空工会与航空公司达成协议后结束罢工
item.description: 代表加拿大西捷航空公司（WestJet Airlines）罢工机械师的工会周一表示，该工会已与航空公司谈判达成一份合同，立即结束了他们的罢工。【原文：The union representing Canada's WestJet Airlines' striking mechanics said on Monday that it has negotiated a contract with the carrier, ending their strike immediately.】

item.title: 空客称将根据 Spirit Aero 交易获得 5.59 亿美元赔偿
item.description: 欧洲空中客车公司（Airbus）周一公布了其计划收购精神航空系统公司（Spirit AeroSystems）某些亏损业务的条款，这是空中客车公司与竞争对手波音公司（Boeing）计划在更大范围内拆分供应商的一部分。【原文：Europe's Airbus on Monday set out the terms under which it plans to buy certain loss-making activities of Spirit AeroSystems as part of a planned wider break-up of the supplier between Airbus and rival Boeing .】

item.title: 波音重启向中国交付新飞机的计划
item.description: 根据飞行跟踪数据和两个消息来源，波音公司已经重新启动了最近几周因中国监管审查而停止的对华宽体喷气机交付，该审查也使美国飞机制造商新的窄体喷气机交付陷入停滞。【原文：Boeing has restarted wide-body jet deliveries to China that were halted in recent weeks due to a Chinese regulatory review which also stalled new narrow-body deliveries by the U.S. planemaker, according to flight tracking data and two sources.】

item.title: 早间竞标欧元走强和法国的马匹交易
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 经过数月谈判，波音公司将以 47 亿美元收购 Spirit Aero 航空公司
item.description: 波音公司周一表示，将以 47 亿美元的全股票价格收购其陷入困境的供应商 Spirit AeroSystems，该交易经过数月谈判后最终敲定。【原文：Boeing said on Monday it would buy its struggling supplier Spirit AeroSystems in a $4.7 billion all-stock deal which was finalized after months of talks, as the aerospace giant tries to solve a full-blown safety and regulatory crisis that has engulfed its key supplier as well.】

item.title: 全球经济 全球需求稳健，6 月亚洲工厂活动扩大
item.description: 周一的调查显示，由于全球经济发展势头稳健，半导体产出前景光明，亚洲工厂活动在6月份有所扩大，这给政策制定者带来了一些希望，使亚洲能够抵御中国需求疲软带来的冲击。【原文：Asia's factory activity expanded in June on solid momentum in the global economy and brightening prospects for semiconductor output, surveys showed on Monday, offering policymakers some hope the region can weather the hit from soft Chinese demand.】

item.title: 税务局称日本地价上涨速度为 2010 年以来最快
item.description: 日本税务局周一表示，2023 年日本地价的上涨速度是 2010 年有可比数据以来最快的，这表明日本在冠状病毒大流行后，在旅游业蓬勃发展的帮助下，经济复苏步伐加快。【原文：Japan's land prices in 2023 rose at the fastest pace since comparable data available in 2010, the tax agency said on Monday, suggesting a recovery gathered pace helped by brisk tourism after the coronavirus pandemic.】

item.title: 财新制造业采购经理人指数显示中国工厂活动以逾三年来最快速度增长
item.description: 周一的一项私营部门调查显示，中国制造业活动因生产增长而创下三年多来的最快增速，即使需求增长放缓也是如此。【原文：China's manufacturing activity grew at the fastest pace in more than three years due to production gains, even as demand growth slowed, a private sector survey showed on Monday, indicating the health of the sector remained robust.】

item.title: 澳新银行-英迪德数据显示，澳大利亚 6 月份招聘广告下降 2.2
item.description: 周一的数据显示，澳大利亚6月份的招聘广告连续第五个月下降，原因是在高利率和经济放缓的情况下，劳动力需求继续放缓。【原文：Australian job advertisements fell for a fifth straight month in June, data showed on Monday, as labour demand continued to ease in the face of high interest rates and a slowing economy.】

item.title: 法国首轮投票后亚洲股市下跌，欧元上涨
item.description: 周一，亚洲股市低迷，交易员们在思考美国利率前景，而欧元则在极右翼在法国第一轮震撼性临时选举中赢得的选票比一些民调预测的要少之后走高。【原文：Asian stocks were subdued on Monday as traders pondered the U.S rates outlook, while the euro edged higher after the far-right won a smaller share of the vote in the first round of France's shock snap election than some polls had projected.】
